Package de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core

Class BatchRenderBackendCoreProfileInternal

java.lang.Object
de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core.BatchRenderBackendCoreProfileInternal
All Implemented Interfaces:
BatchRenderBackend
public class BatchRenderBackendCoreProfileInternal extends Object implements BatchRenderBackend
Internal BatchRenderBackend implementation for OpenGL Core Profile batch rendering that provides OpenGL-based BatchRenderBackend implementations some default functionality to avoid having to reinvent the wheel and to prevent unnecessary code duplication. Suitable for desktop devices. Note: Requires OpenGL 3.2 or higher. Mobiles devices & OpenGL ES are not officially supported yet with this class.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.BatchRenderBackend

    • createNonAtlasTexture

      public int createNonAtlasTexture(@Nonnull BatchRenderBackend.Image image)
      Description copied from interface: BatchRenderBackend
      Creates the given image as a separate, non-atlas texture. This will be called when the texture is not within atlas tolerance, i.e., it would take up too large a percentage of the atlas. This is especially useful when dealing with large textures, such as high-res background images.
      Specified by:
      createNonAtlasTexture in interface BatchRenderBackend
      Parameters:
      image - the Image data loaded by loadImage()
      Returns:
      the texture id of the non-atlas texture

      Description copied from interface: BatchRenderBackend
      Deletes the separate, non-atlas texture from memory. This will be called when a texture that was created with BatchRenderBackend.createNonAtlasTexture(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.BatchRenderBackend.Image) needs to be deleted.
      Specified by:
      deleteNonAtlasTexture in interface BatchRenderBackend
      Parameters:
      textureId - the texture id of the non-atlas texture

    • existsNonAtlasTexture

      public boolean existsNonAtlasTexture(int textureId)
      Description copied from interface: BatchRenderBackend
      Checks whether the non-atlas texture with a texture id specified by textureId exists, i.e. it was created successfully by BatchRenderBackend.createNonAtlasTexture(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.BatchRenderBackend.Image).
      Specified by:
      existsNonAtlasTexture in interface BatchRenderBackend

      Returns:

    • addQuad

      public void addQuad(float x, float y, float width, float height, @Nonnull Color color1, @Nonnull Color color2, @Nonnull Color color3, @Nonnull Color color4, float textureX, float textureY, float textureWidth, float textureHeight, int textureId)
      Description copied from interface: BatchRenderBackend
      Adds a quad textured with a sub-texture from a texture atlas, or for non-atlas quads, adds a quad textured with the non-atlas texture to a new batch. There will always be a beginBatch() call before any addQuad() call. There will usually be many addQuad() calls after a beginBatch() call, but not necessarily. Non-atlas texture batches may have as few as one addQuad() call.
      Specified by:
      addQuad in interface BatchRenderBackend
      Parameters:
      x - the x position in screen coordinates to render this quad at (0,0 is the top left corner)
      y - the y position in screen coordinates to render this quad at (0,0 is the top left corner)
      width - the width of the quad to render
      height - the height of the quad to render
      color1 - the color of the left upper quad vertex
      color2 - the color of the right upper quad vertex
      color3 - the color of the right bottom quad vertex
      color4 - the color of the left bottom quad vertex
      textureX - x coordinate of the top left corner of the sub-texture within the atlas texture, or, for non-atlas textures, of a sub-texture within the non-atlas texture (already normalized in the range 0 to 1 in uv texture atlas coordinates, or for non-atlas textures, in local uv texture coordinates)
      textureY - y coordinate of the top left corner of the sub-texture within the atlas texture, or, for non-atlas textures, of a sub-texture within the non-atlas texture (already normalized in the range 0 to 1 in uv texture atlas coordinates, or for non-atlas textures, in local uv texture coordinates)
      textureWidth - the width of the texture (already normalized in the range 0 to 1 in uv atlas space or, for non-atlas textures, in local uv texture space)
      textureHeight - the height of the texture (already normalized in the range 0 to 1 in uv atlas space, or, for non-atlas textures, in local uv texture space)
      textureId - the id of the texture

    • beginBatch

      public void beginBatch(@Nonnull BlendMode blendMode, int textureId)
      Description copied from interface: BatchRenderBackend
      Begins a new batch with the given BlendMode. Starting a new batch with beginBatch() should store the current batch for later rendering and should start a new batch.
      Specified by:
      beginBatch in interface BatchRenderBackend
      Parameters:
      blendMode - the blending mode this batch should use (will be BlendMode.BLEND in most cases and only very rarely will it be BlendMode.MULTIPLY.
      textureId - the id of the texture that all drawing in this batch will bind to - usually this will be the id of a texture atlas, but in the case of non-atlas textures, we need a separate batch for each one, so textureId will be the id of that single, non-atlas texture

    • render

      public int render()
      Description copied from interface: BatchRenderBackend
      Renders all batches.
      Specified by:
      render in interface BatchRenderBackend
      Returns:
      the number of batches rendered for statistics.

    • removeImageFromAtlas

      public void removeImageFromAtlas(@Nonnull BatchRenderBackend.Image image, int atlasX, int atlasY, int imageWidth, int imageHeight, int atlasTextureId)
      Description copied from interface: BatchRenderBackend
      Removes the specified image from the specified texture atlas. This really could be an empty implementation because there really is nothing that this method needs to do. After a call to this method Nifty might reuse the place in the texture with other calls to BatchRenderBackend.addImageToAtlas(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.BatchRenderBackend.Image, int, int, int).
      Specified by:
      removeImageFromAtlas in interface BatchRenderBackend
      Parameters:
      image - the image to remove from the atlas
      atlasX - the x position in the atlas to insert the image at
      atlasY - the y position in the atlas to insert the image at
      imageWidth - the width of the image in the atlas
      imageHeight - the height of the image in the atlas
      atlasTextureId - the texture id of the atlas texture to remove the image from

    • useHighQualityTextures

      public void useHighQualityTextures(boolean shouldUseHighQualityTextures)
      Description copied from interface: BatchRenderBackend
      Whether or not to render textures with high quality settings. Usually, setting to true will result in slower performance, but nicer looking textures, and vice versa. How high quality textures are rendered versus low quality textures will vary depending on the BatchRenderBackend implementation.
      Specified by:
      useHighQualityTextures in interface BatchRenderBackend

    • fillRemovedImagesInAtlas

      public void fillRemovedImagesInAtlas(boolean shouldFill)
      Description copied from interface: BatchRenderBackend
      Whether or not to overwrite previously used atlas space with blank data. Setting to true will result in slower performance, but may be useful in debugging when visually inspecting the atlas, since there will not be portions of old images visible in currently unused atlas space.
      Specified by:
      fillRemovedImagesInAtlas in interface BatchRenderBackend
